model_answer: A: He starts by showcasing an ultra-efficient car and contrasting it with slow, costly manufacturing cycles. He then demonstrates rapid iteration and modular, lean practices enabled by Agile, Scrum, and modern collaboration tools. Finally, he expands the lens to social good, explicitly inviting the audience to contribute time each week and displaying slides encouraging rapid problem-solving for society.

A: A volunteer effort quickly proves itself by tying for tenth after three months, highlighted by a “BUILT IN 3 MONTHS” slide. Momentum leads to an auto show invitation and a fast, low-cost carbon-fiber body displayed between major brands, followed by widespread media coverage. Later, he notes they sell cars and have volunteers in eight countries, with the car showcased in a hangar.

The speech indicates that Team WIKISPEED's public recognition and reach grew significantly over time. Initially, their efforts were volunteer-driven and focused on building a car within three months. This early success led to an invitation to participate in an auto show and the display of their car among major brands. The media started covering their story, which helped increase their visibility and credibility. As a result, they began selling cars and had volunteers in eight countries. By this point, their car was even showcased in a hangar at an auto show, indicating a significant level of recognition and success.
